title: Installation issue: libint
body:
<!-- Thanks for taking the time to report this build failure. To proceed with the report please:

1. Title the issue "Installation issue: <name-of-the-package>".
2. Provide the information required below.

We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively! -->

`libint` should have a build-time dependency on `python@2.7,3:`.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
```console
$ spack cp2k ^fftw+openmp ^openblas threads=openmp

[+] /home/may/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-sandybridge/gcc-8.3.0/automake-1.16.2-5rkykquanv5gd6pu4tgodtj3i4pq4o6q
[+] /home/may/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-sandybridge/gcc-8.3.0/numactl-2.0.14-wdm3jewxm7ov74iqxswdx2e6htad2ocd
[+] /home/may/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-sandybridge/gcc-8.3.0/gmp-6.1.2-gyma62f4mqbfyyog3arogajakdmhhvcf

==> libint: Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
==> libint: Executing phase: 'configure'
==> libint: Executing phase: 'build'
==> libint: Executing phase: 'install'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 2:

```

### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->

<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->
(I don't have the output of `spack debug report` because I'm reporting this bug on behalf of another brand new user from the spack mailing list: https://groups.google.com/g/spack/c/nWWYLB3KhGI)

### Additional information

<!-- Please upload the following files. They should be present in the stage directory of the failing build. Also upload any config.log or similar file if one exists. -->

Here is the shell session output the user sent me separately from the mailing list: [shell-session.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/6490004/shell-session.txt)

So the error above comes from this `Make` rule:

```make
libint2_types_f.h: $(TOPDIR)/include/libint2.h.i
        $(PYTHON) c_to_f.py $< $@ Libint_t
```

... which below you can see comes from `generated/fortran/Makefile` in `spack-src/` and on my sane system `configure` detects it correctly as `/usr/bin/python` but on the user's system the Make variable `$(PYTHON)` it's clearly incorrectly set to `/home/may/xtb/python/` for some god-awful reason which is why I think that `libint` needs a build-time dependency on `python` instead of leaving it open to bizarre shell environmental variables.  Looking at `configure.ac` it checks for python2.7 or python3, which is why I suggest setting a build-time dependency of `python@2.7,3:`

```console
$ spack cd -b libint +fortran tune=cp2k-lmax-5
$ grep -B1 c_to_f.py generated/fortran/Makefile
libint2_types_f.h: $(TOPDIR)/include/libint2.h.i
	$(PYTHON) c_to_f.py $< $@ Libint_t
$ grep -i python config.log
configure:5228: checking for python
configure:5244: found /usr/bin/python
configure:5255: result: python
ac_cv_prog_PYTHON=python
PYTHON='python'
$ grep -i python generated/configure.ac
AC_CHECK_PROGS(PYTHON,python python3 python2 python2.7,python)
```

<!-- Some packages have maintainers who have volunteered to debug build failures. Run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mention them here if they exist. -->

### General information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [ ] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers
- [ ] I have uploaded the build log and environment files
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
